page.title: 09THE PILGRIM FATHERS
page.content: In May 1982 Americans from the{John {Howland Society}arrived at Fenstanton for the dedication of a bell to be installed in the church.It weighed {448lb}and was given by the Society in {memory of John Howland.}Howland was a {Fenstanton }man and a passenger on the {Mayflower.}John went to Leyden,Holland to join the English separatist church. They left for{America}and a new life.Their ship the{SPEEDWELL}had to be left in Plymouth,so they went to America on Mayflower.The voyage lasted nine weeks,full of storms and gales. In one incident{John was swept {overboard}but luckily he was{hauled to {safety.}In November the settlers landed at a place called{Cape Cod}in {Massachusetts.} Howland had ten children and eighty six grandchildren. John's brother Simon was baptised in Fenstanton and his parents born there.
